intro: Gamochaeta badillana, commonly known as the narrowleaf gamochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Gamochaeta badillana is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
